name: Windows Script
summary: Learn about .WS files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: The Windows Script Host is a tool that system administrators can use to automate a variety of login and administrative actions. To do so, administrators create and run Windows Scripts, which may be saved as WS files.

WS files are plain text files. Notably, WS files can include routines written using JScript, VBScript, BASIC, Perl, Python, and many other programming languages. To create WS files, administrators use Microsoft Notepad, Microsoft Visual Studio Code, or another text editor.
NOTE: Windows Scripts are more commonly saved as .WSF files.

description: A WS file contains an executable script that can be run via the Windows Script Host. The script may be comprised of various types of routines and elements, including JScript and VBScript routines and XML elements. When you double-click a WS file, the Windows Script Host will automatically run the script the file contains.

instructions: If you want to view or edit a WS file's contents, you can open it with Microsoft Notepad, Microsoft Visual Studio Code, or any other text editor.
In Windows, you can run the script a WS file contains by double-clicking the file or using the wscript command-line command (as described here.)
